page.title: 04Curdridge Show.
page.content: The Curdridge Show is held annually to raise money for the Reading Room. It is held on the third Saturday of July to avoid other shows in the area. It has a horticultural show, vintage car rally, trade stands, sideshows, stalls, a tea tent, and ring events. These include dancing, fancy dress competitions and a band. Other attractions are a pet show, baby show and a craft fayre. Some money is raised beforehand as an insurance against bad weather, by selling draw tickets, sponsorship, trade stands, and selling tickets for the Barn Dance which is held in the marquee on the evening of the Show. Approximately three thousand people attend the Show, and it usually makes about Â£3,500 profit. The expenses are around Â£2,000 including Â£600 for the marquee.
